posts.post_content:
I agree its a bit overhyped in that you're not likely to see T2 decks running 4 Karn's. However, he is a fantastic tool for Eldrazi ramp decks, Valakut, Compliment to venser...you can go on. It's a very fun card and should have some slots in decks in the future.  
  
But yes you should have more field control in your deck and not crutch on getting Karn out. Especially in response to turn 2 [Glistener elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glistener elf) deadliness.

But yes you should have more field control in your deck and not crutch on getting Karn out. Especially in response to turn 2 Glistener elf deadliness.

Posted By: prolifFTW (5/13/2011 8:04:01 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This card is way overhyped, and will drop in price. Why? Because while he is undeniably powerful, he also paints an ENORMOUS crosshair on his forehead the instant he enters the battlefield. The only time he's going to survive is when you already have board advantage, and if that's the case, why would you want to restart the game? You have board advantage. He doesn't have a huge effect on game state in most situations. In MOST cases, he's going to be either a very expensive vindicate, or a very expensive discard then MAYBE vindicate if your opponent doesn't kill him off right away. Watch for his price to drop. A lot.

Even if you don't get to pull off his ultimate (shouldnt be too hard to do. You can do it in as little as 2 turns.), just the simple act of forcing them to exile cards and keeping them exiled is pretty awesome.

posts.post_content:
His 2nd ability is awesome! It's like a spine of Ish with a Vindicate. And even better, you only pay 7 mana once, something you need Venser or alike to do with Spine. Sick in itself! Ult is Insurance and it slows down your opp or at least makes em' think twice about whatever they play. And if you combo him with Venser, he's pretty much safe keeping. I really like this card. He does so much and the fact that he's colorless makes him playable in almost any deck. He's going to redefine how removal is done for yrs to come in this game. Top 3 PW's for sure, arguably 2nd best.   
  
Isn't there a 0 cost counter card in an older set? Future sight maybe.. What happens if after the game is restarted, cards are drawn, mulligans are taken, but BEFORE exiled cards are returned to play, opp plays that counter card?? I wish I could remember the name of the card to make sure I have details right but assuming I do, that could get a little confusing..

Posted By: Tori_Rofocale (8/23/2011 12:42:25 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Karn is an suitably epic planeswalker, and ever since [Ghostfire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ghostfire) (which happens to look fantastic in Knights vs. Dragons) I've been interested in colorless stuff. The frames always look awesome, and they make sense because the only way to represent it is with *nothing*. All the colorless Eldrazi spells look amazing, and the tokens too.  
Things like [Steel Hellkite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Steel Hellkite) fascinate me too, the white glow in its mouth and the colorless firebreathing ability. Cards such as that and [All is Dust](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=All is Dust) represent pure, massive power and that's really cool.  
Anyone who's ever seen a spirit token from Champions knows how much of a shame it is ):  
I guess I just like the aesthetics of things  
4.5/5
posts.html:
